It‚Äôs time for government to update our laws in order to protect a free and open internet.

Regulating the internet under this antiquated 1930s law has prohibited small internet companies from making investments in rural areas, which runs counter to the rural broadband investments I continue to push for.

That's why I‚Äôm supporting three bills that allow the @FTC to ensure true net neutrality by: 

‚úÖProhibiting blocking, throttling, and paid prioritization for internet trafficking 
‚úÖ Creating more transparency from internet service providers.
Regulating the internet under a law that was written to regulate telephones that had dials and party lines is not the way we protect net neutrality.

I was proud to join @RepSpanberger in leading a bipartisan effort requesting funding to expand rural broadband internet connectivity across rural America and to ensure equal educational and economic opportunities in rural communities.

Affordable broadband access is critical for the economic development of rural communities. It enables farmers to use precision ag techniques, patients to access medical care remotely, children to conduct research for school projects, & business to engage with customers.
